intro: Adonis cyllenea, commonly known as the Cyprus bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant produces a cluster of small, hairy fruits. Adonis cyllenea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
